tit.e: Hatamoto-yoriaiseki (a family rank of high-ranking hatamoto, direct vassal of the shogun)

sen.j: 旗本寄合席（はたもとよりあいせき）は、江戸幕府の3,000石以上の上級旗本無役者・布衣以上の退職者（役寄合）の家格。
sen.e: Hatamoto-yoriaiseki (a family rank of high-ranking hatamoto [direct retainers of the bakufu, which is a form of Japanese feudal government headed by a shogun],) was kakaku (familystatus of high-ranking hatamoto with income of 3,000 koku or greater without official appointment, or retirees who possessed social standing higher than hoi (yakuyoriai).

Hatamoto-yoriaiseki was kakaku (family status) of high-ranking hatamoto with income of 3,000 koku or greater without official appointment, or retirees (known as yakuyoriai) who possessed social standing higher than hoi (those with the rank who wore clothes that did not bear family crests) in the Edo bakufu (Japanese feudal government headed by a shogun).
sen.cmt: 旗本寄合席について、既に説明を前のセルでしているので、削除致しました。また、familyの前の「（」を削除するなど、表記について修正を致しました。広辞苑等を参考に、全く同じものではないと判断し、修正致しました。
sen.e: Hatamoto-yoriaiseki was kakaku (family status) of high-ranking hatamoto with income of 3,000 koku or greater without official appointment, or retirees (known as yakuyoriai) who possessed social standing higher than hoi (those with the rank who wore clothes that did not bear family crests) in the Edo bakufu (Japanese feudal government headed by a shogun).
An official name is yoriai.
Its correct name was Yoriai.
sen.cmt: official nameですと公式名称に近い意味になるので、書き換えました。
sen.e: Its correct name was Yoriai.

sen.j: 旗本の家格にはほかに高家・小普請組がある。
sen.e: Other social standings of hatamoto include Koke (a master of ceremony; honorable family) and Kobushin-gumi (samurai without official appointments who receive small salaries).
Other social standings of hatamoto include Koke (a master of ceremony; honorable family) and Kobushin-gumi (samurai without official appointments who receive small salaries).
Other social standings of hatamoto include Koke (a master of ceremony; honorable family) and Kobushin-gumi (samurai without official appointments who receive small salaries).
Wakadoshiyori-shihai (under the control of wakadoshiyori [a managerial position in Edo bakufu])
It was under the control of Wakadoshiyori (junior councilor).
sen.cmt: 「若年寄による支配」という文章だと考え、修正致しました。
sen.e: It was under the control of Wakadoshiyori (junior councilor).

sen.j: 交代寄合は旗本寄合席に含まれ、寄合御役金を支払うが、老中支配である。
sen.e: Kotaiyoriai (alternate yoriai, a family status of samurai warriors in the Edo period) was included in hatamoto-yoriaiseki, and yoriai-oyakukin (a kind of tax) should be paid; it was under the control of roju (senior councilor of the Tokugawa shogunate).
sen.cmt: 御役金の対訳は報酬のようになっていますが、ここでは反対に上納金を指しているようで、またこの文にも一致すると思い、対訳は使用しませんでした。簡単な意訳表記しました。
sen.e: Kotaiyoriai (alternate yoriai, a family status of samurai warriors in the Edo period) was included in hatamoto-yoriaiseki, and although yoriai-oyakukin (a kind of tax) had to be paid, they were under the control of roju (senior councilor).
sen.cmt: 時制などを修正致しました。
sen.e: Kotaiyoriai (alternate yoriai, a family status of samurai warriors in the Edo period) was included in hatamoto-yoriaiseki, and although yoriai-oyakukin (a kind of tax) had to be paid, they were under the control of roju (senior councilor).

sen.j: 幕末期には交代寄合を含め180家存在した。
sen.e: 180 families including kotaiyoriai existed in the last days of the Tokugawa shogunate.
In the last days of the Tokugawa shogunate, there were 180 hatamoto-yoriaiseki including kotaiyoriai.
sen.cmt: 文頭に数字を表記しない形に書き換えました。
sen.e: In the last days of the Tokugawa shogunate, there were 180 hatamoto-yoriaiseki including kotaiyoriai.

sen.j: 享保4（1719年）年6月、留守居支配（留守居は老中支配）より若年寄支配の寄合となり、元文5（1740年）年、3,000石以上の旗本を全て寄合とした。
sen.e: It had been under the control of rusui (caretaker or keeper [official post in the Edo period]; rusui is under the control of rojyu [senior councillor of the Tokugawa shogunate]), but it became under control of wakadoshiyori in 1719, and hatamoto with income of 3,000 koku or greater was appointed as yoriai.

Yoriai had been under the control of rusui (caretaker or keeper [official post in the Edo period]; rusui is under the control of rojyu [senior councilor of the Tokugawa shogunate]), but it became under the control of wakadoshiyori in June 1719, and in 1740, hatamoto with income of 3,000 koku or greater was appointed as yoriai.
sen.cmt: 6月が訳漏れでしたので、補いました。また、councillorをcouncilor(アメリカ式）に修正致しました。
sen.e: Yoriai had been under the control of rusui (caretaker or keeper [official post in the Edo period]; rusui is under the control of rojyu [senior councilor of the Tokugawa shogunate]), but it became under the control of wakadoshiyori in June 1719, and in 1740, hatamoto with income of 3,000 koku or greater was appointed as yoriai.

sen.j: 寄合の基準は以下のとおり。

Karoku (hereditary stipend) of 3,000 koku or greater

sen.j: 家禄3,000石以下であっても留守居・大番・書院番・小姓組の次代は寄合に入る
sen.e: The next generation of rusui (caretaker or keeper [official post in the Edo era]), oban (obangumi unit [castle guards of hatamoto]), shoinban (the castle guards) and koshogumi (page corps) were included in yoriai, even if it had not been more than 3000 koku.

Even if the karoku was 3,000 koku or less, the following generation of rusui (caretaker or keeper [official post in the Edo era]), oban (obangumi unit [castle guards of hatamoto]), shoinban (the castle guards) and koshogumi (page corps) were considered as yoriai.
sen.cmt: 3000石以下について表現を修正致しました。上のセルにて「3000以上」という表記がありますので、厳密に言うとこのセルについては3,000「未満｣ととらえるべきなのかもしれませんが、原文に沿って訳出致しました。「未満」が正しいとらえ方であれば、文頭をless than 3,000に修正したく思います。
sen.e: Even if the karoku was 3,000 koku or less, the following generation of rusui (caretaker or keeper [official post in the Edo era]), oban (obangumi unit [castle guards of hatamoto]), shoinban (the castle guards) and koshogumi (page corps) were considered as yoriai.

sen.j: 家禄3,000石以下でも交代寄合は寄合に入る
sen.e: Kotaiyoriai was included in yoriai, even if it had not been more than 3000 koku.
Kotaiyoriai was included in yoriai, even if the karoku was 3,000 koku or less.
sen.cmt: 3000石以下について表現を修正致しました。上部セルにて「3000以上」という表記がありますので、厳密に言うとこのセルについては3,000「未満｣ととらえるべきなのかもしれませんが、原文に沿って訳出致しました。「未満」が正しいとらえ方であれば、末尾をless than 3,000に修正したく思います。
sen.e: Kotaiyoriai was included in yoriai, even if the karoku was 3,000 koku or less.

sen.j: 家禄3,000石以下布衣以上の役職を勤め、無役となった者は役寄合として寄合に入る
sen.e: Retirees who had served a post of not more than 3000 koku and of higher than hoi were included in yoriai as yakuyoriai.
Retirees who had served a post of 3,000 koku or less with a rank higher than hoi were included in yoriai as yakuyoriai.
sen.cmt: 3000石以下について表現を修正致しました。上部セルにて「3000以上」という表記がありますので、厳密に言うとこのセルについては3,000「未満｣ととらえるべきなのかもしれませんが、原文に沿って訳出致しました。
sen.e: Retirees who had served a post of 3,000 koku or less with a rank higher than hoi were included in yoriai as yakuyoriai.

sen.j: 例外として、旧大名の金森氏・本多氏（本多忠央系）は寄合に入る
sen.e: As an exception, former daimyos (Japanese territorial lord), Kanamori clan and Honda clan (the lineage of Tadanaka HONDA), were included in yoriai.
As an exception, former daimyos (Japanese territorial lord), Kanamori clan and Honda clan (the lineage of Tadanaka HONDA), were included in yoriai.
As an exception, former daimyos (Japanese territorial lord), Kanamori clan and Honda clan (the lineage of Tadanaka HONDA), were included in yoriai.

sen.j: ただし、3,000石以上であっても表高家に属する者は寄合に入らない
sen.e: However, even with 3000 koku or greater, those who belonged to omote-koke were not included in yoriai.

However, even with the karoku of 3,000 koku or greater, those who belonged to omote-koke (a post in the Edo bakufu that was in charge of its rituals and so on that had no official court rank) were not included in yoriai.
sen.cmt: 表高家について説明が必要と考え、広辞苑などを参考に補足致しました。
sen.e: However, even with the karoku of 3,000 koku or greater, those who belonged to omote-koke (a post in the Edo bakufu that was in charge of its rituals and so on that had no official court rank) were not included in yoriai.

sen.j: 寛政2（1790年）年に寄合より非役職の寄合肝煎が選出され、寄合より役職・出役への推薦・斡旋を行うようになる。
sen.e: Yoriai-kimoiri without official appointment was selected among yoriai, and they conducted recommendation and intercession to posts with official appointments or syutuyaku (assignment of other regions) from 1790.
sen.cmt: 出役：意訳併記しました。
sen.e: Yoriai-kimoiri without official appointment was selected from yoriai in 1790, and they recommended and made intercessions in appointing posts and assigning additional posts from yoriai.
sen.cmt: 意訳の様ですが、少し表現を修正致しました。「出役」については、大辞泉などによると「でやく」とも読むようです。
sen.e: Yoriai-kimoiri without official appointment was selected from yoriai in 1790, and they recommended and made intercessions in appointing posts and assigning additional posts from yoriai.

sen.j: 小普請金にあたる、寄合御役金は100石に付き金2両の割合で8月と2月の分納であった。
sen.e: Yoriai-oyakukin, which is equivalent for kobusikin (a kind of tax), was paid by installments in August and February at the rate of 2 ryo per 100 koku.
sen.cmt: 小普請金：簡単に意訳併記しました。
sen.e: Yoriai-oyakukin, which was equivalent to kobushinkin (a kind of tax), was paid by installments in August and February at the rate of 2 ryo per 100 koku.
sen.cmt: equivalentの後はofまたはtoが続きます。また1部時制を修正致しました。また、小普請金をヘボン式の綴りに修正致しました。
sen.e: Yoriai-oyakukin, which was equivalent to kobushinkin (a kind of tax), was paid by installments in August and February at the rate of 2 ryo per 100 koku.
